body:
For now, the way you set a color is:

* R opens red for editing
* G opens green for editing
* B opens blue for editing
* After doing that, type in a value from 000-255 to set that color value!

There will be a square in the top right corner of the screen showing the current cube color.

A half baked solution, I know, but it'll have to do while I add more advanced GUI functionality.

Edit: Oh, almost forgot: The color code for porpl is R:128, G:90, B:213!
